Car data.brake: Whether the brake pedal is pressed (100) or not (0).
Car data.date: The UTC date and time, in ISO 8601 format.
Car data.driver_number: The unique number assigned to an F1 driver (cf. Wikipedia).
Car data.drs: The Drag Reduction System (DRS) status (see mapping table below).
Car data.meeting_key: The unique identifier for the meeting. Use latest to identify the latest or current meeting.
Car data.n_gear: Current gear selection, ranging from 1 to 8. 0 indicates neutral or no gear engaged.
Car data.rpm: Revolutions per minute of the engine.
Car data.session_key: The unique identifier for the session. Use latest to identify the latest or current session.
Car data.speed: Velocity of the car in km/h.
Car data.throttle: Percentage of maximum engine power being used.

Drivers.broadcast_name: The driver's name, as displayed on TV.
Drivers.country_code: A code that uniquely identifies the country.
Drivers.driver_number: The unique number assigned to an F1 driver (cf. Wikipedia).
Drivers.headshot_url: URL of the driver's face photo.
Drivers.meeting_key: The unique identifier for the meeting. Use latest to identify the latest or current meeting.
Drivers.name_acronym: Three-letter acronym of the driver's name.
Drivers.session_key: The unique identifier for the session. Use latest to identify the latest or current session.
Drivers.team_colour: The hexadecimal color value (RRGGBB) of the driver's team.

Intervals.date: The UTC date and time, in ISO 8601 format.
Intervals.driver_number: The unique number assigned to an F1 driver (cf. Wikipedia).
Intervals.gap_to_leader: The time gap to the race leader in seconds, +1 LAP if lapped, or null for the race leader.
Intervals.interval: The time gap to the car ahead in seconds, +1 LAP if lapped, or null for the race leader.
Intervals.meeting_key: The unique identifier for the meeting. Use latest to identify the latest or current meeting.
Intervals.session_key: The unique identifier for the session. Use latest to identify the latest or current session.

Laps.date_start: The UTC starting date and time, in ISO 8601 format. This date is approximate.
Laps.driver_number: The unique number assigned to an F1 driver (cf. Wikipedia).
Laps.duration_sector_1: The time taken, in seconds, to complete the first sector of the lap.
Laps.duration_sector_2: The time taken, in seconds, to complete the second sector of the lap.
Laps.duration_sector_3: The time taken, in seconds, to complete the third sector of the lap.
Laps.i1_speed: The speed of the car, in km/h, at the first intermediate point on the track.
Laps.i2_speed: The speed of the car, in km/h, at the second intermediate point on the track.
Laps.is_pit_out_lap: A boolean value indicating whether the lap is an 'out lap' from the pit (true if it is, false otherwise).
Laps.lap_duration: The total time taken, in seconds, to complete the entire lap.
Laps.lap_number: The sequential number of the lap within the session (starts at 1).
Laps.meeting_key: The unique identifier for the meeting. Use latest to identify the latest or current meeting.
Laps.segments_sector_1: A list of values representing the 'mini-sectors' within the first sector (see mapping table below).
Laps.segments_sector_2: A list of values representing the 'mini-sectors' within the second sector (see mapping table below).
Laps.segments_sector_3: A list of values representing the 'mini-sectors' within the third sector (see mapping table below).
Laps.session_key: The unique identifier for the session. Use latest to identify the latest or current session.
Laps.st_speed: The speed of the car, in km/h, at the speed trap, which is a specific point on the track where the highest speeds are usually recorded.

Location.date: The UTC date and time, in ISO 8601 format.
Location.driver_number: The unique number assigned to an F1 driver (cf. Wikipedia).
Location.meeting_key: The unique identifier for the meeting. Use latest to identify the latest or current meeting.
Location.session_key: The unique identifier for the session. Use latest to identify the latest or current session.
Location.x: The 'x' value in a 3D Cartesian coordinate system representing the current approximate location of the car on the track.
Location.y: The 'y' value in a 3D Cartesian coordinate system representing the current approximate location of the car on the track.
Location.z: The 'z' value in a 3D Cartesian coordinate system representing the current approximate location of the car on the track.

Meetings.circuit_key: The unique identifier for the circuit where the event takes place.
Meetings.circuit_short_name: The short or common name of the circuit where the event takes place.
Meetings.country_code: A code that uniquely identifies the country.
Meetings.country_key: The unique identifier for the country where the event takes place.
Meetings.country_name: The full name of the country where the event takes place.
Meetings.date_start: The UTC starting date and time, in ISO 8601 format.
Meetings.gmt_offset: The difference in hours and minutes between local time at the location of the event and Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).
Meetings.location: The city or geographical location where the event takes place.
Meetings.meeting_key: The unique identifier for the meeting. Use latest to identify the latest or current meeting.
Meetings.meeting_official_name: The official name of the meeting.
Meetings.year: The year the event takes place.

Overtakes.date: The UTC date and time, in ISO 8601 format.
Overtakes.meeting_key: The unique identifier for the meeting. Use latest to identify the latest or current meeting.
Overtakes.overtaken_driver_number: The unique number assigned to the overtaken F1 driver (cf. Wikipedia).
Overtakes.overtaking_driver_number: The unique number assigned to the overtaking F1 driver (cf. Wikipedia).
Overtakes.position: The position of the overtaking F1 driver after the overtake was completed (starts at 1).
Overtakes.session_key: The unique identifier for the session. Use latest to identify the latest or current session.

Pit.date: The UTC date and time, in ISO 8601 format.
Pit.driver_number: The unique number assigned to an F1 driver (cf. Wikipedia).
Pit.lap_number: The sequential number of the lap within the session (starts at 1).
Pit.meeting_key: The unique identifier for the meeting. Use latest to identify the latest or current meeting.
Pit.pit_duration: The time spent in the pit, from entering to leaving the pit lane, in seconds.
Pit.session_key: The unique identifier for the session. Use latest to identify the latest or current session.

Position.date: The UTC date and time, in ISO 8601 format.
Position.driver_number: The unique number assigned to an F1 driver (cf. Wikipedia).
Position.meeting_key: The unique identifier for the meeting. Use latest to identify the latest or current meeting.
Position.session_key: The unique identifier for the session. Use latest to identify the latest or current session.

Race control.category: The category of the event (CarEvent, Drs, Flag, SafetyCar, ...).
Race control.date: The UTC date and time, in ISO 8601 format.
Race control.driver_number: The unique number assigned to an F1 driver (cf. Wikipedia).
Race control.flag: Type of flag displayed (GREEN, YELLOW, DOUBLE YELLOW, CHEQUERED, ...).
Race control.lap_number: The sequential number of the lap within the session (starts at 1).
Race control.meeting_key: The unique identifier for the meeting. Use latest to identify the latest or current meeting.
Race control.message: Description of the event or action.
Race control.scope: The scope of the event (Track, Driver, Sector, ...).
Race control.sector: Segment ('mini-sector') of the track where the event occurred? (starts at 1).
Race control.session_key: The unique identifier for the session. Use latest to identify the latest or current session.

Sessions.circuit_key: The unique identifier for the circuit where the event takes place.
Sessions.circuit_short_name: The short or common name of the circuit where the event takes place.
Sessions.country_code: A code that uniquely identifies the country.
Sessions.country_key: The unique identifier for the country where the event takes place.
Sessions.country_name: The full name of the country where the event takes place.
Sessions.date_end: The UTC ending date and time, in ISO 8601 format.
Sessions.date_start: The UTC starting date and time, in ISO 8601 format.
Sessions.gmt_offset: The difference in hours and minutes between local time at the location of the event and Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).
Sessions.location: The city or geographical location where the event takes place.
Sessions.meeting_key: The unique identifier for the meeting. Use latest to identify the latest or current meeting.
Sessions.session_key: The unique identifier for the session. Use latest to identify the latest or current session.
Sessions.session_name: The name of the session (Practice 1, Qualifying, Race, ...).
Sessions.session_type: The type of the session (Practice, Qualifying, Race, ...).
Sessions.year: The year the event takes place.

Session result.dnf: Indicates whether the driver Did Not Finish the race. This can be true only for qualifying and race sessions.
Session result.dns: Indicates whether the driver Did Not Start the race. This can be true only for qualifying and race sessions.
Session result.dsq: Indicates whether the driver was disqualified.
Session result.driver_number: The unique number assigned to an F1 driver (cf. Wikipedia).
Session result.duration: Either the best lap time (for practice or qualifying), or the total race time (for races), in seconds. In qualifying, this is an array of three values for Q1, Q2, and Q3.
Session result.gap_to_leader: The time gap to the session leader in seconds, or +N LAP(S) if the driver was lapped. In qualifying, this is an array of three values for Q1, Q2, and Q3.
Session result.number_of_laps: Total number of laps completed during the session.
Session result.meeting_key: The unique identifier for the meeting. Use latest to identify the latest or current meeting.
Session result.position: The driver’s final position at the end of the session.
Session result.session_key: The unique identifier for the session. Use latest to identify the latest or current session.

Starting grid.driver_number: The unique number assigned to an F1 driver (cf. Wikipedia).
Starting grid.lap_duration: Duration, in seconds, of the qualifying lap.
Starting grid.meeting_key: The unique identifier for the meeting. Use latest to identify the latest or current meeting.
Starting grid.session_key: The unique identifier for the session. Use latest to identify the latest or current session.

Stints.compound: The specific compound of tyre used during the stint (SOFT, MEDIUM, HARD, ...).
Stints.driver_number: The unique number assigned to an F1 driver (cf. Wikipedia).
Stints.lap_end: Number of the last completed lap in this stint.
Stints.lap_start: Number of the initial lap in this stint (starts at 1).
Stints.meeting_key: The unique identifier for the meeting. Use latest to identify the latest or current meeting.
Stints.session_key: The unique identifier for the session. Use latest to identify the latest or current session.
Stints.stint_number: The sequential number of the stint within the session (starts at 1).
Stints.tyre_age_at_start: The age of the tyres at the start of the stint, in laps completed.

Team radio.date: The UTC date and time, in ISO 8601 format.
Team radio.driver_number: The unique number assigned to an F1 driver (cf. Wikipedia).
Team radio.meeting_key: The unique identifier for the meeting. Use latest to identify the latest or current meeting.
Team radio.session_key: The unique identifier for the session. Use latest to identify the latest or current session.

Weather.date: The UTC date and time, in ISO 8601 format.
Weather.meeting_key: The unique identifier for the meeting. Use latest to identify the latest or current meeting.
Weather.session_key: The unique identifier for the session. Use latest to identify the latest or current session.
